properties.Location: 3361 S. Signal Butte Road  Fire Station 219
properties.URL_1: Learn more about station 219 solar power
properties.Describe: The goal was LEED silver, but the outcome was LEED gold. This Mesa fire station is a great role model for other sustainability efforts in the city and is one of the first LEED certified City of Mesa buildings.

properties.Location: Fire Station 220  5763 E Main St. Mesa  AZ 85205
properties.URL_1: Learn more about station 220 solar power
properties.Describe: One of the first LEED certified city of Mesa buildings. 7.5% of the energy used comes from the sun with a 15.18 kW photovoltaic system.

properties.URL_1: Learn more about the center's solar power
properties.Describe: This building provides recreation for people of all ages and 44% of it's own energy through solar power

properties.URL_1: <Learn more about station 212 solar power
properties.Describe: Prospects set on 67% of building energy requirements to come from solar power

properties.URL_1: Read more about this police station's solar power
properties.Describe: This police station is seeing a projected savings of 60% building energy use

properties.URL_1: More about Red Mountain Park solar
properties.Describe: This Mesa solar installation concentrates the sun's power up to 650 times tradition solar cells via concentrated photo-voltaic structures and 10 dual axis trackers.

properties.URL_1: About the Pecos Park and Ride solar initiative
properties.Describe: This 562-vehicle park-and-ride location offers solar power generation along side free parking for public transportation riders

properties.URL_1: See more about this water plant's solar
properties.Describe: A water treatment plant that is a big part of the city's goal to provide a minimum of 20% of city operations energy from renewable sources by 2025. 15% of the plant's energy use is supported by the installation.

properties.URL_1: Learn more about the solar power at this justice building
properties.Describe: Justice will be served! The installation will offset building electrical demand by 12% thanks to this solar installation completed December 2014

properties.Location: 2050 W Rio Salado Pkwy Tempe  AZ 85281
properties.URL_1: Learn more about the guard house solar power
properties.Describe: The East Valley Bus Operations and Maintenance guardhouse provides protection and solar power!

properties.Building: Household Product Collection Center and Fire Training Facility
properties.URL_1: Learn more about the solar at this collection center
properties.Describe: A location for Tempe residents to safely dispose of household hazardous waste and an opportunity fo the city to produce 3000 kilowatt hours of energy annually

properties.Location: 30205 N Black Canyon Hwy. Phoenix  AZ 85085
properties.URL_1: Read more about the solar power at this waste station
properties.Describe: The transfer station separates solid waste and prepares it for the landfill, all the while providing external lighting powered by the sun

properties.URL_1: Read more about sustainability efforts at this Phoenix entertainment center
properties.Describe: Entertainment, clean energy, LEED silver certification, and a number of other sustainability endeavors go hand in hand at the Phoenix Convention Center

properties.URL_1: Learn more about energy efficiency at Phoenix parks
properties.Describe: The community center provides a space of recreation and a little extra energy production by the sun.

properties.URL_1: Solar power at the senior center
properties.Describe: Seniors of Phoenix can enjoy community services in a senior center built with sustainability in mind. The center is shaded by 108 native trees and includes a water-harvesting system among other green building efforts.

properties.URL_1: More about this
properties.Describe: McCarty on Monroe is an affordable senior living community built with sustainability in mind. Flourescent fixtures are used, flooring is made of recycled rubber, 154 solar panels on the roof, and desert landscaping.

properties.URL_1: More about solar power at the pool
properties.Describe: A community pool operated by the City of Phoenix Aquatics Department with a green edge--changing rooms use natural daylight, evaporative cooling, and solar panels power the facility during the summer months.

properties.URL_1: Learn more
properties.Describe: Multi-generational center with solar panels

properties.Building: Nina Mason Pulliam Rio Salado Audubon Center
properties.URL_1: Explore the audubon center
properties.Describe: Headquarters of the Arizona office of the Audubon Society. The building is awaiting LEED certification and has a waste water recycling system along with low water use fixtures, pervious surfaces, bioswales, and energy efficient systems.

properties.URL_1: Explore this library's sustainability
properties.Describe: Burton Barr Central is the largest library in Phoenix and gets some of its power from solar! The library is also certified LEED silver.
